importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the current timeline of the postseason in 2025.
The scheduled start date of Game 1 of the World Series, marking the beginning of the final championship matchup between the Blue Jays and Dodgers.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The 2025 postseason season, culminating in the World Series between the Blue Jays and Dodgers, is a pivotal moment in Major League Baseball history.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays have won their first World Series berth in over 30 years after defeating the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in Game 7 of the ALCS.
The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll in baseball, are the top contenders in the 2025 World Series, having won five NL pennants and two World Series titles in the past nine years.
The Dodgers' postseason performance was dominant, including a Game 4 NLCS win by Shohei Ohtani, who achieved a historic performance with three home runs and 6.1 shutout innings.
The Blue Jays' strong offensive performance in the ALCS, including 34 runs over four games against the Yankees, contrasted with defensive and pitching strengths of the Dodgers.

The Blue Jays' path to the World Series was tough, requiring seven games against the Mariners, who had a 2-0 series lead and 14 home runs, but ultimately fell due to errors and a late home run by George Springer.
The Dodgers' bullpen was a weak point during the regular season, potentially offering a tactical opportunity for the Blue Jays in the World Series.
Game 1 of the World Series is scheduled for Friday, October 24, in Toronto.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Toronto, Canada.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays have earned their first trip to the World Series in over 30 years after defeating the Seattle Mariners in Game 7 of the ALCS, marking a significant milestone in the franchise's history.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Los Angeles, California.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the most dominant team in baseball this season, with a large payroll, recent success in the postseason, and a strong defense and pitching staff, making them a top contender for the 2025 World Series title.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way star player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, known for excelling both as a pitcher and a batter.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a legendary performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, with three home runs and 6.1 shutout innings, a performance widely considered one of the greatest individual games in baseball history.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A key player for the Toronto Blue Jays, known for his power-hitting abilities.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Springer hit a game-winning three-run home run in Game 7 of the ALCS, ending the Mariners' hopes and securing the Blue Jays' spot in the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Seattle, Washington.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the opponents in the ALCS, and despite a strong early series lead, they were eliminated due to errors and a late home run by Springer, highlighting their lack of postseason success and history of never reaching the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were defeated by the Dodgers in the NLDS, showing the Dodgers' strength in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were swept by the Dodgers in the NLCS, demonstrating the Dodgers' dominance in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: New York Yankees
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in New York, New York.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Yankees were the division rivals of the Blue Jays in the ALDS, where Toronto's offense outperformed them with 34 runs over four games.

namedEntities.name: Pittsburgh Pirates
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Pirates defeated the Dodgers in a September sweep, showing that the Dodgers had struggles in the regular season, despite their postseason success.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays, who coached and played in the ALCS.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Jeff Hoffman commented on the Blue Jays' ability to stay close throughout the ALCS, emphasizing their perseverance and resilience in overcoming the Mariners.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the 2025 World Series for the first time in over 30 years after defeating the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in Game 7 of the American League Championship Series. The Blue Jays, who had a remarkable turnaround from a 2024 last-place finish, overcame a strong Mariners team that led 2-0 in the series with 14 home runs. The Dodgers, with the largest payroll and a dominant postseason run — including a historic performance by Shohei Ohtani — are set to face the Blue Jays in the World Series. The Dodgers, who swept the Milwaukee Brewers and defeated the Philadelphia Phillies in the playoffs, are considered a formidable opponent, though their bullpen weakness may present an opportunity for Toronto. Game 1 of the World Series is scheduled for Friday, October 24, in Toronto.
title: Dodgers and Blue Jays Face Off in 2025 World Series
